question: In the reaction between hydrogen sulphide and acidified permanganate solution,
choices: <katex>$\text{H}_2\text{S}$</katex> is reduced to S, <katex>$\text{MnO}_4^-$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$\text{Mn}^{2+}$</katex>
<katex>$\text{H}_2\text{S}$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$\text{SO}_2$</katex>, <katex>$\text{MnO}_4^-$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$\text{MnO}_2$</katex>
<katex>$\text{H}_2\text{S}$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$\text{SO}_2$</katex>, <katex>$\text{MnO}_4^-$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$\text{Mn}^{2+}$</katex>
<katex>$\text{H}_2\text{S}$</katex> is oxidised to S, <katex>$\text{MnO}_4^-$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$\text{Mn}^{2+}$</katex>
explanation: Sulphide is oxidised to Sulphur (S) and Permanganate is reduced to Manganese(II) ion.
